sentence.text: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II mutations have been found to be responsible for Tricho-Dento-Osseous (tryptophan catabolic process to kynurenine) syndrome, charcoenzyme A biosynthetic processerized by kinky hair, thin-pitted enamel and increased bone density.

entity.text: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Here we show that the regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II mutation (c.533â€‰AAAAAG; Q178R) attenuates osteogenic potential and senescence of bone mesenchymal stem cells (BMSCs) isolated from a tryptophan catabolic process to kynurenine patient, providing a molecular explanation for abnormal increased bone density.
